revised_title: Detection of Benzoline Vapour and Inflammable Vapours in Air Using Safety-Lamps
tldr: The authors investigate the use of safety-lamps in detecting benzoline vapour and other inflammable vapours in the air. They find that the hydrogen flame in the safety-lamp can detect a quantity of benzoline vapour in air that is one thirty-sixth of the explosive proportion and one twentieth of the inflammable proportion. The benzoline flame shows a distinct cap when the amount of benzoline vapour is one ninth of that required for an explosive mixture and one fifth of that which will yield an inflammable mixture.
